metadata.h1: What do companies really expect from Data and Analytics?

all_paragraphs: What do companies really expect from their Data and Analytics teams? Have you ever thought about it? As a data professional, what do companies expect from you? That you develop the state-of-the-art in machine learning models? Create innovative and disruptive solutions that will completely transform their business? Some of them maybe, but most expect from Data and Analytics the same that they want from any other department like Marketing or Sales, that they bring results!

Bring results don’t mean to use all of the technologies, tools, and trends for Big Data, Analytics, and Data Science, but how to use data with intelligence and how to create value for the business from them. Using the technology of course, but as a means and not as an end.

For that, companies need great data professionals. Trained in main technologies, but mainly knows how to create value from the data. Who deeply understands the pains and challenges of the business and knows how the data can help in this journey, either with KPI’s, deep analysis and even sophisticated machine learning models, but always connected to the business.
So what exactly are the skills that a data professional should have?

It’s very hard to define all skills required in a data professional, as there are many careers in this area, such as Data Engineers and Data Scientists, Big Data, Analytics and Data Visualization specialists, and many others.
Regardless of the chosen career, worth a few tips about what expect from a data professional:

Know the business numbers like nobody else — almost everything you do in a data department is related to numbers. If you don’t know the main numbers of the company hardly you will create a relevant thing for the business.

Follow the questions, not the answers — in the Analytics world find out the right question is most important then find out the answers. A simple question like “why did gross revenue decrease?” can easily take you to another 20 or 30 questions and you need to go that route, don’t try to run away from it.

Don’t live in a bubble — many times we see great data professionals closed in their world and outlying of what happens in the world out there. There are people more introverted than others of course, but you need to know what happens around you, even in your own way. Remember that your mission is to help the company to win their challenges using data and you only can do this living the company, interacting with other departments and people.

Storytelling — as important as building a good analysis is knowing how to show it. Good analysis frequently is shown to the top management of the company and they don’t are interested in knowing your rocket science details, they prefer to believe that you know what you do. They are more interested to understand what are the insights and takeaways and how It can be applied in the business. Knowing how to create a good presentation and how to tell this story is essential.

Machine Learning can’t just be a sophisticated and expensive coffee maker — before you want to develop the state-of-the-art algorithm, spend time knowing the data, spend time knowing the business. Talk to people, with departments. Understand their pains and their goals. It’s not because you used the most advanced technique in the world that it will bring some value to the business.

Data quality matters — with the advent of Big Data, we are able to process large volumes of data, even if not structured. But that doesn’t mean you don’t have to worry about data quality anymore. Spend time evaluating its structure and especially the quality before spreading your finds.

Some of these tips can be more useful than others depending on your professional moment or your challenges with data. Also, remember that there is no magic recipe, each challenge is a challenge and you will always need to adjust to it. The most important thing as a Data and Analytics professional is to understand that your commitment is to the result and you will only be able to do this knowing how to extract value from the data.
